title: Accessibility - Standings Table
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user with Talkback mode/Voice Assistant enabled
custom_steps:
WHEN the user opens the Standings Tab
AND they click on a line item/team in the standings
custom_expected: THEN the talkback reads back the individual line item modeled after this formatted example: "Houston Astros, 16 wins, 15 losses, .516 win percentage, 4.5 games back, 7 and 3 record in last 10 games, 3 game winning streak"

title: Scoreboard card cells
custom_steps:
When selecting a scoreboard card cell, read out a full description of the game.

General Notes:

For TalkBack, ERA (earned run average) should be read as “E.R.A.” This is to avoid TalkBack saying “era”, like “end of an era”.

*PREGAME*

Notes:

- Spell out time zones (“Mountain Time”, “Pacific Time”, etc)

- If the game was postponed, replace start time with “postponed”

||| Template | Examples
|| awayTeam versus homeTeam, game starts at gameStartTime --- Probable pitchers: awayTeamName pitcher awayTeamPitcher, awayTeamPitcherWins and awayTeamPitcherLosses, awayTeamPitcherERA, homeTeamName pitcher homeTeamPitcher, homeTeamPitcherWins and homeTeamPitcherLosses | ---Standard--- “Yankees versus Blue Jays, game starts at 7:05 PM eastern time. Probable pitchers, Yankees pitcher Smith, 10 and 5, 3.05 E.R.A.. Blue Jays Pitcher Johnson, 5 and 20, 4.11 E.R.A.” ---TBD Pitcher---  “Yankees versus Blue Jays, game starts at 7:05 PM eastern time. Probable pitchers: Yankees pitcher TBD. Blue Jays pitcher Johnson, 5 and 20, 4.11 E.R.A.” ---Postponed--- “Yankees versus Blue Jays, game postponed.” ||

LIVE

Notes:

- If the game is tied, change to: awayTeam versus homeTeam, game is tied awayTeamRuns to homeTeamRuns.

- If a game is suspended, ignore batter/pitcher info and append the following  to the score: “game is suspended.”

||| Template | Examples
|| awayTeam versus homeTeam, gameState winningTeam leads winningTeamRuns to losingTeamRuns. ---Pitching---:  pitcherName, pitcherInningsPitched innings pitched pitcherERA E.R.A. ---Batting---: batterName batterHitTotal and batterAtBatTotal. batterBattingAverage batting average.| Standard “Yankees versus Blue Jays. Top 3. Yankees lead, 3 to 0. Pitching: Bradley, 3.1 innings pitched, 3.15 ERA. Batting: Wilson, 0 and 2, .326 batting average.” Tie Game “Yankees versus Blue Jays. Bottom 4. Game is tied 0 to 0. Pitching: Bradley, 3.1 innings pitched, 3.15 ERA. Batting: Wilson, 0 and 2, .326 batting average.” Mid-Inning “Yankees versus Blue Jays. Middle 6. Game is tied 0 to 0.”  Suspended. “Yankees versus Blue Jays. Game suspended. Yankees lead, 3 to 2.”

FINAL

Notes:

- If a game did not end in 9 innings, append the total innings to the game state — gameState inningTotal innings

||| Template | Examples
|| awayTeam versus homeTeam, gameState. winningTeam won, winningTeamScore to losingTeamScore. The winning pitcher was winningPitcherName, winningPitcherWins and winningPitcherLosses record with a winningPitcherERA E.R.A.  The losing pitcher was losingPitcherName, losingPitcherWins and losingPitcherLosses record with a losingPitcherERA E.R.A. The save pitcher was savePitcherName withsavePitcherSaves saves and a savePitcherERA E.R.A.  | **Win-Loss-Save**. “Yankees versus Blue Jays, final. Yankees won 2 to 0. The winning pitcher was Wheeler. 5 and 3 record with a 2.15 ERA. The losing pitcher was Kershaw. 10 and 3 record with 3.11 ERA. The save pitcher was Neris with 10 saves and a 1.12 ERA.”  **Non-Standard Inning Total**. “Yankees versus Blue Jays, final 11 innings. Yankees won 2 to 0. title: Talkback - Flicking left and right switches between UI elements
custom_steps:
GIVEN a user in the MLB app
WHEN the user activates Talkback
THEN flicking left and right should switch between UI elements
AND when the user reaches the bottom of the screen, flicking right should scroll down in the app

title: Talkback Behavior during Audio Scrubber
custom_steps:
As an accessibilty user, when I interact with the scrubber, I would like it to read back information about its state.

Scrubber - Archive

When scrubber is released (touchup), the following copy should be read aloud:

First, say: ”Adjustable: Media Position:”

Then, say:

“[Y Minutes], [Z Seconds]”, where the time read is the time the user is at since broadcast start

Scrubber - Archive

*When scrubber is released (touchup), the following copy should be read aloud:

 

First, say: ”Adjustable: Media Position:”

Then, say:

If the user is at the start of the broadcast, say “start of broadcast”

If the user is at a point that is not the beginning, say: “[Y Minutes], [Z Seconds]”, where the time read is the time the user is at since broadcast start

Technical Notes / Concerns
* Media playing over talkback
* Test on Legacy for Priority (Archive Games - MLB.tv)
* iOS - possibly baseline
* Best Effort to help user navigate - redesign would be ideal
* Timebox to 5 points for navigation

title: Scoreboard card cell linescore
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Talkback is enabled
AND the scoreboard tab is selected in card view
AND games are available with completed, partially completed, not-started and early-ended innings

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the column is tapped in the linescore for a completed inning
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN then it will read:
inning inningNumber awayTeamName awayTeamRuns runs homeTeamName homeTeamRuns runs

Example: Inning 4, Yankees 3 runs, Red Sox 2 runs

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the column is tapped in the linescore where the top of the inning is completed (2nd team cell blank)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN then it will read:
inning inningNumber awayTeamName awayTeamRuns runs

Example: Inning 4, Yankees 3 runs

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the column is tapped in the linescore for an inning that has not started
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN then it will read:
inning inningNumber 

Example: Inning 4

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the column is tapped in the linescore for the last inning of a game that ended early (unplayed innings show 'x')
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN then it will read:
inning inningNumber awayTeamName awayTeamRuns runs

Example: Inning 9, Yankees 3 runs

Note: does not read the “X” that appears in the unplayed innings

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the R (runs) column is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN then it will read:
awayTeamName awayTeamRuns homeTeamName homeTeamRuns 

Example: runs, Yankees 10, Red Sox 11

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the H (hits) column is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN then it will read:
awayTeamName awayTeamits homeTeamName homeTeamhits 

Example: hits, Yankees 10, Red Sox 11

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the E (errors) column is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN then it will read:
awayTeamName awayTeamErrors homeTeamName homeTeamErrors 

Example: errors, Yankees 0, Red Sox 1

title: Talkback with Hide Scores On
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Talkback is enabled on the device 
AND the Hide Scores setting is set to On
AND a card for a completed or partially completed game is in focus

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on a scoreboard card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Score, pitching details etc. will not be read. (If the data does not display it should not be read.)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the card on the team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Score, pitching details etc. will not be read. (If the data does not display it should not be read.)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN hide scores is turned off and the tabs are refreshed and the user taps the scoreboard or team page cards
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Score, pitching details etc. will be read.
